hanzi-su-wiki:
婿

Значения

Жених, зять

Мнемоника

Справа — мясо 月 и подвернувшаяся нога 疋 в значении «крабья ножка» — чтобы съесть мясо, надо выломать клешню. Вместе — зять, муж дочери 女, для которого она, как краб, раздвигает ноги и с которым живёт половой жизнью.

Варианты

壻, 聟
purpleculture_pinyin:
xù
son-in-law; husband
зять; муж
rtega_mnemonic:
婿婿RS壻son-in-law, husband
  • woman 女 inspecting the meat 胥 of her future son-in-law or husband
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 胥 indicates the sound; 女 (woman) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
夫婿 [ fū xù ]: (literary) husband
翁婿 [ wēng xù ]: father-in-law (wife's father) and son-in-law
乘龙快婿 [ chéng lóng kuài xù ]: ideal son-in-law
赘婿 [ zhuì xù ]: son-in-law living at wife's parent's house
小婿 [ xiǎo xù ]: my son-in-law (humble); I (spoken to parents-in-law)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 女 [ nǚ ] woman, girl; female
    • 胥 [ xū ] all, together, mutually
heisig_chinese_memo: The virgin son-in-law tries to understand the new, mysterious part of his woman's body - but with little success. It's a zoo down there! He tries for a month, and finally gets somewhere.
heisig_constituent: bridegroom, woman, zoo, critters, moon, month, flesh, part of the body
heisig_story: What makes a man a bridegroom is obviously a woman and her dowry, here presented as a small zoo (animals were often used for this purpose in earlier societies) and a month away from it all (the "honeymoon").
myStory:
мелкий чиновник (в Китае) 胥

тело которое считает скотину, его шапка об этом говорит
koohiiStory1: The virgin bridegroom tries to understand the new, mysterious part of his woman´s body - but with little success. It´s a zoo down there! (primitives placement: the part of the body is ´down there´ - the woman is ´left´ unsatisfied).
koohiiStory2: The only reason anyone talks about a bridegroom is if they´re about to or have just gotten married. Of course, then you have to go on your honeymoon. So you take your woman to the zoo for a month. Pretty cool honeymoon.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Have you heard the tale of the woman who fell in love with a coat rack during a full moon and made him her groom? It's a true story! She even had a wedding ceremony and had more coat racks sitting in the grooms side. The moon will make people do craaaazy things.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine what it would be like to fall in love with a coat rack and make it YOUR groom.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The best part of the story is that the only coat on the coat rack groom was a moose coat (むこ). So the groom was a really skinny stick with a giant moose hair coat hanging down it.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Could you love a moose coat enough to marry it?
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the woman (女) is together (胥) with her bridegroom
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The virgin son-in-law tries to understand the new, mysterious part of his woman's body - but with little success. It's a zoo down there! He tries for a month, and finally gets somewhere.

婿字的基本解释

婿
xù
丈夫：夫婿。
女儿、妹妹及其他晚辈的丈夫：女婿。妹婿。侄婿。甥婿。贤婿。翁婿。

婿字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xù］
亦作“偦2”。同“壻1”。

婿字的英文翻译

◎ 婿
husband, son-in-low

婿字的康熙字典解释

【丑集下】【女字部】　婿； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页266第09
【集韻】同壻。

婿字的起名意思

女儿的丈夫；⒉妇人称自己的丈夫。

Source glyph
husband
Name meaning
Daughter’s husband; ⒉Women call her husband.
婿
形声字。女表意,篆书形体像一位女子,表示女子之夫;胥(xd)表声,胥指有才智者,表示有才智者方可做女子之夫。本
义是丈夫,常指女儿的丈夫。
①丈夫:夫~|妹~(称妹妹的丈夫)。②女儿的文夫:
女~「翁~。
夫~ 佳~ 郎~ 妹~ 女~翁~ 赘~ 子~
xù
得婚|婿
“隶
муж
Пиктофонетические символы.
Женское выражение означает, что сценарий печати выглядит как женщина, что означает муж женщины; Сюй (xd) означает голос мудрого человека, что означает, что только мудрый мужчина может быть мужем женщины.
Первоначальное значение - «муж» и часто относится к мужу дочери.
①Муж: Муж ~ | Сестра ~ (называется мужем младшей сестры).
②Муж дочери: женщина ~ "Вэн ~.
Муж ~ Цзя ~ Ланг ~ Сестра ~ Женщина ~ Вэн ~ Цзо ~ Сын ~
Женился | зять
"писец
xù
только в сочетаниях
1) зять
2) муж
Radicals: 女, 疋, 月  (woman, coat-rack, moon)
Meaning Mnemonic
Have you heard the tale of the woman who fell in love with a coat rack during a full moon and made him her groom? It's a true story! She even had a wedding ceremony and had more coat racks sitting in the grooms side. The moon will make people do craaaazy things.
Imagine what it would be like to fall in love with a coat rack and make it YOUR groom.
Reading Mnemonic
The best part of the story is that the only coat on the coat rack groom was a moose coat (むこ). So the groom was a really skinny stick with a giant moose hair coat hanging down it.
Could you love a moose coat enough to marry it?
